output.conclusion: This course provided a foundational understanding of Strength of Materials. Further study and practice are encouraged to master these concepts.
output.introduction: Welcome to Strength of Materials! This course introduces the fundamental concepts needed to understand how materials behave under stress and strain.

chapters.description: Definition of stress and strain, types of stress (tensile, compressive, shear), and Hooke's Law. Explanation of elastic and plastic behavior.
Analysis of members under axial loads, including stress distribution and deformation. Introduction to statically determinate and indeterminate problems.
Understanding stress-strain diagrams for ductile and brittle materials. Key properties like yield strength, ultimate tensile strength, and fracture point.
Introduction to torsion in circular shafts. Calculation of shear stress and angle of twist. Power transmission by shafts.
Introduction to bending moments and shear forces in beams. Understanding bending stress and shear stress distribution in beams.
Definition and calculation of moment of inertia for various cross-sections. Parallel axis theorem and its application.
Introduction to beam deflection. Methods for calculating deflection (e.g., direct integration). Boundary conditions and support types.
Analysis of elements subjected to combined axial, bending, and torsional loads. Introduction to principal stresses.
Discussion of different material properties such as Young's modulus, Poisson's ratio, and thermal expansion coefficient.
